data.name: CmdConfig
data.value: CONFIG_FILE

data.name: CmdConfigDescription

data.value: FILE

data.name: CmdConfigFileOptionDescription
data.value: The NuGet configuration file to use.

data.name: CmdCurrentRuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: Use current runtime as the target runtime.

data.name: CmdDeprecatedDescription
data.value: Lists packages that have been deprecated. Cannot be combined with '--vulnerable' or '--outdated' options.

data.name: CmdDisableParallelOptionDescription
data.value: Prevent restoring multiple projects in parallel.

data.name: CmdFileDescription
data.value: Path to the file-based program.

data.name: CmdOptionForceDescription
data.value: Force conversion even if there are malformed directives.

data.name: CmdForceRestoreOptionDescription
data.value: Force all dependencies to be resolved even if the last restore was successful. This is equivalent to deleting project.assets.json.

data.name: CmdFormatDescription
data.value: Specifies the output format type for the list packages command.

data.name: CmdHighestMinorDescription
data.value: Consider only the packages with a matching major version number when searching for newer packages. Requires the '--outdated' option.

data.name: CmdHighestPatchDescription
data.value: Consider only the packages with a matching major and minor version numbers when searching for newer packages. Requires the '--outdated' option.

data.name: CmdIgnoreFailedSourcesOptionDescription
data.value: Treat package source failures as warnings.

data.name: CmdIncludeSourceDescription
data.value: Include PDBs and source files. Source files go into the 'src' folder in the resulting nuget package.

data.name: CmdIncludeSymbolsDescription
data.value: Include packages with symbols in addition to regular packages in output directory.

data.name: CmdLockedModeOptionDescription
data.value: Don't allow updating project lock file.

data.name: CmdLockFilePathOption
data.value: LOCK_FILE_PATH

data.name: CmdLockFilePathOptionDescription
data.value: Output location where project lock file is written. By default, this is 'PROJECT_ROOT\packages.lock.json'.

data.name: CmdNoBuildOptionDescription
data.value: Do not build the project before packing. Implies --no-restore.

data.name: CmdNoDependenciesOptionDescription
data.value: Do not restore project-to-project references and only restore the specified project.

data.name: CmdNoHttpCacheOptionDescription
data.value: Disable Http Caching for packages.

data.name: CmdOutdatedDescription
data.value: Lists packages that have newer versions. Cannot be combined with '--deprecated' or '--vulnerable' options.

data.name: CmdOutputVersionDescription
data.value: Specifies the version of machine-readable output. Requires the '--format json' option.

data.name: CmdNoRestoreDescription
data.value: Do not restore before running the command.

data.name: CmdEnvironmentVariableDescription
data.value:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi

data.name: CmdTestEnvironmentVariableDescription
data.value:
Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This will force the tests to be run in an isolated process. This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Examples: -e VARIABLE=abc -e VARIABLE="value with spaces" -e VARIABLE="value;seperated with;semicolons" -e VAR1=abc -e VAR2=def -e VAR3=ghi

data.name: CmdEnvironmentVariableExpression
data.value: NAME="VALUE"

data.name: IncorrectlyFormattedEnvironmentVariables
data.value: Incorrectly formatted environment variables: {0}

data.name: SelfContainedOptionDescription
data.value: Publish the .NET runtime with your application so the runtime doesn't need to be installed on the target machine. The default is 'false.' However, when targeting .NET 7 or lower, the default is 'true' if a runtime identifier is specified.

data.name: FrameworkDependentOptionDescription
data.value: Publish your application as a framework dependent application. A compatible .NET runtime must be installed on the target machine to run your application.

data.name: SelfContainAndNoSelfContainedConflict
data.value: The '--self-contained' and '--no-self-contained' options cannot be used together.

data.name: DisableBuildServersOptionDescription
data.value: Force the command to ignore any persistent build servers.

data.name: ArchArgumentName
data.value: ARCH

data.name: OSArgumentName
data.value: OS

data.name: ArtifactsPathOptionDescription
data.value: The artifacts path. All output from the project, including build, publish, and pack output, will go in subfolders under the specified path.

data.name: ArtifactsPathArgumentName
data.value: ARTIFACTS_DIR

data.name: CmdBlameCrashCollectAlwaysDescription
data.value: Enables collecting crash dump on expected as well as unexpected testhost exit.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode and collects a crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. This option depends on the version of .NET used, the type of error, and the operating system.
For exceptions in managed code, a dump will be automatically collected on .NET 5.0 and later versions. It will generate a dump for testhost or any child process that also ran on .NET 5.0 and crashed. Crashes in native code will not generate a dump. This option works on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Crash dumps in native code, or when targetting .NET Framework, or .NET Core 3.1 and earlier versions, can only be collected on Windows, by using Procdump. A directory that contains procdump.exe and procdump64.exe must be in the PATH or PROCDUMP_PATH environment variable.
The tools can be downloaded here: https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/procdump
To collect a crash dump from a native application running on .NET 5.0 or later, the usage of Procdump can be forced by setting the VSTEST_DUMP_FORCEPROCDUMP environment variable to 1.
Implies --blame.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. Supported values are full (default) and mini. Implies --blame-crash.

data.name: CmdBlameDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating problematic tests that cause the test host to crash or hang, but it does not create a memory dump by default.
When a crash is detected, it creates an sequence file in TestResults/guid/guid_Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests that were run before the crash.
Based on the additional settings, hang dump or crash dump can also be collected.
Example: Timeout the test run when test takes more than the default timeout of 1 hour, and collect crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. (Crash dumps require additional setup, see below.) dotnet test --blame-hang --blame-crash Example: Timeout the test run when a test takes more than 20 minutes and collect hang dump. dotnet test --blame-hang-timeout 20min

data.name: CmdBlameHangDescription
data.value: Run the tests in blame mode and enables collecting hang dump when test exceeds the given timeout.

data.name: CmdBlameHangDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. The supported values are full (default), mini, and none. When 'none' is used then test host is terminated on timeout, but no dump is collected. Implies --blame-hang.

data.name: CmdBlameHangTimeoutDescription
data.value: Per-test timeout, after which hang dump is triggered and the testhost process is terminated. Default is 1h. The timeout value is specified in the following format: 1.5h / 90m / 5400s / 5400000ms. When no unit is used (e.g. 5400000), the value is assumed to be in milliseconds. When used together with data driven tests, the timeout behavior depends on the test adapter used. For xUnit, NUnit and MSTest 2.2.4+ the timeout is renewed after every test case, For MSTest before 2.2.4, the timeout is used for all testcases.

data.name: cmdCollectDescription
data.value: The friendly name of the data collector to use for the test run. More info here: https://aka.ms/vstest-collect

data.name: cmdCollectFriendlyName
data.value: DATA_COLLECTOR_NAME

data.name: CmdListTestsDescription
data.value: List the discovered tests instead of running the tests.

data.name: CmdLoggerDescription
data.value: The logger to use for test results. Examples: Log in trx format using a unique file name: --logger trx Log in trx format using the specified file name: --logger "trx;LogFileName=<TestResults.trx>" See https://aka.ms/vstest-report for more information on logger arguments.

data.name: CmdLoggerOption
data.value: LOGGER

data.name: CmdNoBuildDescription
data.value: Do not build the project before testing. Implies --no-restore.

data.name: CmdOutputDescription
data.value: The output directory to place built artifacts in.

data.name: CmdPathToLogFile
data.value: LOG_FILE

data.name: CmdPathTologFileDescription
data.value: Enable verbose logging to the specified file.

data.name: CmdPathToResultsDirectory
data.value: RESULTS_DIR

data.name: CmdResultsDirectoryDescription
data.value: The directory where the test results will be placed. The specified directory will be created if it does not exist.

data.name: CmdSettingsDescription
data.value: The settings file to use when running tests.

data.name: CmdSettingsFile
data.value: SETTINGS_FILE

data.name: CmdTestAdapterPath
data.value: ADAPTER_PATH

data.name: CmdTestAdapterPathDescription
data.value: The path to the custom adapters to use for the test run.

data.name: CmdTestCaseFilterDescription
data.value: Run tests that match the given expression. Examples: Run tests with priority set to 1: --filter "Priority = 1" Run a test with the specified full name: --filter "FullyQualifiedName=Namespace.ClassName.MethodName" Run tests that contain the specified name: --filter "FullyQualifiedName~Namespace.Class" See https://aka.ms/vstest-filtering for more information on filtering support.

data.name: CmdTestCaseFilterExpression
data.value: EXPRESSION

data.name: CrashDumpTypeArgumentName
data.value: DUMP_TYPE

data.name: HangDumpTypeArgumentName
data.value: DUMP_TYPE

data.name: HangTimeoutArgumentName
data.value: TIMESPAN

data.name: TestCmdNoLogo
data.value: Run test(s), without displaying Microsoft Testplatform banner

data.name: TestCmdOutputDir
data.value: OUTPUT_DIR

data.name: CmdExpressionName
data.value: EXPRESSION

data.name: CmdMaxParallelTestModulesDescription
data.value: The max number of test modules that can run in parallel.

data.name: CmdNoAnsiDescription
data.value: Disable ANSI output.

data.name: CmdNoProgressDescription
data.value: Disable progress reporting.

data.name: CmdNumberName
data.value: NUMBER

data.name: CmdProjectOrSolutionDescriptionFormat
data.value: Defines the path of the project or solution file to test. Use path to the project file, or path to the directory containing the project file. If not specified, it defaults to the current directory.

data.name: CmdProjectOrSolutionPathName
data.value: PROJECT_OR_SOLUTION_PATH

data.name: CmdConfigFileDescription
data.value: Specifies a testconfig.json file.

data.name: CmdConfigFilePath
data.value: CONFIG_FILE

data.name: CmdDiagnosticOutputDirectoryDescription
data.value: Output directory of the diagnostic logging. If not specified the file will be generated inside the default 'TestResults' directory.

data.name: CmdDiagnosticOutputDirectoryPath
data.value: DIAGNOSTIC_DIR

data.name: CmdRootPathName
data.value: ROOT_PATH

data.name: CmdSolutionDescription
data.value: Defines the path of the solution file to test. Use path to the solution file, or path to the directory containing the solution file. If not specified, it defaults to the current directory.

data.name: CmdSolutionPathName
data.value: SOLUTION_PATH

data.name: CmdTestModulesDescription
data.value: Run tests for the specified test modules.

data.name: CmdTestModulesRootDirectoryDescription
data.value: The test modules have the specified root directory.

data.name: CmdTestOutputDescription
data.value: Verbosity of test output.
